comments:
I'm trying to connect to cvs using ext or extssh from Eclipse (currently using
v3.1M3, but this has been a problem ever since I left 3.0M4) on WinXP.

When I try to add a new location (filling out the form properly, I'm quite
convinced), I get the message: "Error validating location "". Keep location
anyway?" If I opt to keep the location, I can't see any of the projects in the
repository I'm supposed to be browsing. 

Somehow, it seems that the repository path isn't read. When I try to add the
same connection with pserver, everything works fine.

I'm experiencing this on a dualboot laptop with WinXP SP2. When I boot up in
Lunix (Red Hat Enteroruse Linux release 3) I have no trouble making a CVS
connection using ext.
Is there anything in the Error log?
What CVS server version are you using? Is there anything in the Error log?

Probably because your ssh account on the server is not configured correctly. We
all run extssh daily without problems.

> What CVS server version are you using?

Sorry for the late reply!

My cvs client:
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.17 (client/server)

On the cvs server:
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.5 (client/server)

> Is there anything in the Error log?

is what I get:

and try to browse the contents of HEAD, the following is written to the log:

Regarding Jean-Michel Lemieux's comment that my ssh account might not be
configured properly on the server: Can this be an explanation, given the fact
that I connect smoothly with ext from another OS on the same computer? Should my
ssh account be configured differently server side, depending on whether I use
ext or extssh?

I'm aware of the fact that this works for most people. It used to work for me as
well, when I used Eclipse v3.0 m4.

Anyway, thanks for looking into this! If there's anything else I can do, please
let me know! Also, please let me know if it was wrong to reopen the bug. I fully
understand if this bug (or mistake on my part) has a low priority.
The NPE is happening in Jsch. Assigning to YMNK for comment.

May I ask you about your J2SE version number?
It seems that NPE has been thrown at Diffie-Hellman key exchange.
In processing that key exchange, extssh plug-in will use JCE(Java Cryptography 
Extention) and JCE is only included in J2SE 1.4 or later.

I have same problem from XP SP2 with Eclipse 3.02 Build id: 200503110845, Java
1.5.0_02

Is there any resolution for this problem?

(In reply to comment #8)
> I have same problem from XP SP2 with Eclipse 3.02 Build id: 200503110845, Java
> 1.5.0_02
> 
> Is there any resolution for this problem?

None I have found. I've tried everything I can think of, short of reinstalling
the whole OS. I don't want ot use pserver, so I'm back to using cvs in command
line :-/

Please share if someone comes across a solution!

Just wanted to say that this is no longer an issue with the brand spanking new
Eclipse 3.1 :-)

Thanks for an excellent product!
